posts.post_content:
He is in two colors that are really good at avoiding getting blocked. If you have been milling the opponent (likely if this guy is in your deck), he kills after two to three hits. If you haven't, it only takes five to six hits to kill an opponent. This is potentially more than his 5 CMC Standard compatriots, but also potentially way less.  
  
Most important, his ability doesn't target, which means that you can keep milling even after a Witchbane Orb (in Standard) or Leyline of Sanctity in other formats. Most mill decks just roll over to those cards, but this guy pushes past that, and still meets your win con really efficiently. This actually makes him situationally better than Anime Jace.  
  
He is not bad. He's worse than Nemesis of Reason but not strictly worse. Worse than Nemesis of Reason can still be pretty good.
posts.html:

If you haven't, it only takes five to six hits to kill an opponent. This is potentially more than his 5 CMC Standard compatriots, but also potentially way less.

Most important, his ability doesn't target, which means that you can keep milling even after a Witchbane Orb (in Standard) or Leyline of Sanctity in other formats. Most mill decks just roll over to those cards, but this guy pushes past that, and still meets your win con really efficiently. This actually makes him situationally better than Anime Jace.

He is not bad. He's worse than Nemesis of Reason but not strictly worse. Worse than Nemesis of Reason can still be pretty good.

posts.post_content: I think people are definitely undervaluing him. Provided your opponent drew five lands over the entire game (if not, they're probably manascrewed), it takes him only three hits to finish your opponent on his own. Combined with other Dimir mill stuff, even relatively plain ones like [Paranoid Delusions](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Paranoid Delusions), he can easily kill your opponent in two strikes, possibly a single one.

posts.post_content:
Bit boring, but the ability can be a pain, I've bled horribly to [Mind Grind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Grind) before now. Still, like [Szadek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Szadek) and [Undead Alchemist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Undead Alchemist), you have to wonder whether it's simply easier to just punch them to death conventionally (Though the Alchemist's main trick is to generate chump blockers whilst milling really).  
  
Then again, if you ask yourself that question, why not simply ask yourself why you don't run Black Lotuses and murder people instantly? It's all about style guys!

posts.post_content:
I really, really like this guy. Fantastic art and good mill. He's fantastic because he works so well with both [Lazav, Dimir Mastermind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lazav, Dimir Mastermind) and [Consuming Aberration](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Consuming Aberration).   
  
If you need more "unblockableness" or immunity to [Dimir Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dimir Charm) on this guy, just enchant him with [Tricks of the Trade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tricks of the Trade) or [Way of the Thief](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Way of the Thief). Now you're a happy camper and your opponent isn't.

Posted By: WoWbolt17 (5/1/2013 2:58:09 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Hands down the BEST artwork ever printed on a vampire creature card. I love it.  
  
As for the actual creature, he's rather blah. A 2/4 that mills out your opponent? I suppose it's okay. For 3UB, they should've just said he was un-blockable. I don't think he would have been so broken, since he will only exist with [Heartless Summoning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartless Summoning) in standard for a little while and he isn't hexproof. The sad thing is that since he has flying, he'll be vulnerable to [Vampire Nighthawks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nighthawks) and will be chump blocked [Lingering Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lingering Souls), but once those cards rotate out I think he'll see much more play.   
  
Kind of a bummer, but the artwork more then makes up for it.
posts.html:
Hands down the BEST artwork ever printed on a vampire creature card. I love it.

As for the actual creature, he's rather blah. A 2/4 that mills out your opponent? I suppose it's okay. For 3UB, they should've just said he was un-blockable. I don't think he would have been so broken, since he will only exist with Heartless Summoning in standard for a little while and he isn't hexproof. The sad thing is that since he has flying, he'll be vulnerable to Vampire Nighthawks and will be chump blocked Lingering Souls, but once those cards rotate out I think he'll see much more play.

Kind of a bummer, but the artwork more then makes up for it.
